rule.name: Declare element 'SafeControl' for each implemented WebControl
rule.description:
For each non-abstract class which is derived from 'System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl' a SafeControl entry must be placed inside the manifest.xml.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy referenced Assembly with correct version, culture and public key token
rule.description:
If an assembly references a different assembly then version, culture and public key token of the referenced assembly must be the same or use BindingRedirects.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not set SPSite.CatchAccessDeniedException property
rule.description:
Property SPSite.CatchAccessDeniedException is reserved for internal use. Use the SPSecurity.CatchAccessDeniedException property instead to specify whether SharePoint Foundation traps and handles "Access Denied" exceptions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not set SPSite.ReadLocked property
rule.description:
Property SPSite.ReadLocked is reserved for internal and is not intended to be used directly from your code. Use the IsReadLocked property instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use SPWeb.Properties property
rule.description:
SPWeb.Properties is a StringDictionary and doesn't support casing for keys/values (everything gets converted to lowercase). Instead use SPWeb.AllProperties. SPWeb.AllProperties is a Hashtable and supports additional types of data.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call deprecated members
rule.description:
Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not call deprecated methods or properties.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement deprecated interfaces
rule.description:
Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not implement deprecated interfaces.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not inherit from deprecated type
rule.description:
Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not inherit from deprecated type.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reference deprecated types
rule.description:
Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not reference deprecated types.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not update list of blocked extensions
rule.description:
The assembly should not access property Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebApplication.BlockedFileExtensions and also update the web application. The rule assumes that the list of blocked file extensions has been changed by the code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid setting 'AllowUnsafeUpdates' on SPWeb
rule.description:
The assembly should not call Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb.AllowUnsafeUpdates to run make changes to SPWeb with a lower security context. Setting this property to true opens security risks, potentially introducing cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid setting 'AllowUnsafeUpdates' on SPSite
rule.description:
The assembly should not call Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite.AllowUnsafeUpdates to run make changes to SPSite with a lower security context. Setting this property to true opens security risks, potentially introducing cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call 'WindowsIdentity.Impersonate'
rule.description:
The assembly should not call WindowsIdentity.Impersonate() to run code with higher permissions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not set 'AllowEveryoneViewItems' for SPList to TRUE
rule.description:
The property ListAllowEveryoneViewItems of the SPList object should not be set to true, as it allows every authenticated user of the web application to access the list items when the URL is known.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid usage of 'RunWithElevatedPrivileges'
rule.description:
The assembly should not call Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSecurity.RunWithElevatedPrivileges to run code with higher permissions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not add PageParserPaths to web.config
rule.description:
PageParserPaths can be used to enable inline code in ASPX pages which is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call 'HttpUtility.HtmlEncode'.
rule.description:
The assembly should not call HttpUtility.HtmlEncode(string) to encode strings. Use 'SPHttpUtility.HtmlEncode' instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not nest calls to RunWithElevatedPrivileges
rule.description:
Do not call RunWithElevatedPrivileges inside a existing RunWithElevatedPrivileges.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not access SharePoint API via reflection
rule.description:
It is not supported to access non public properties or methods of the SharePoint API, e.g. via reflection.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not read ConnectionString from SPContentDatabase
rule.description:
There is no reason to read the connection string of a SharePoint content database except if you want to read from the database which is not supported.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not query SharePoint databases directly
rule.description:
It is not allowed to read or write directly to SharePoint databases. Use API, webservices etc. instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not start Process.Start in a feature and event receiver
rule.description:
Do not start a new process in a feature and event receiver. Sometimes this may be used to run PowerShell or a batch command but this can bring the execution into timeout issues, block the process e.g. in case of errors or opening message boxes.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not write to the SharePoint file system
rule.description:
Do not create directories or write to files in the SharePoint file system. If this is necessary (e.g. in TimerJobs) ensure that no SharePoint system files are overwritten, that the file size is limited and will not exceed uncontrolled and ensure, that these files are deleted during deinstallation of your code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not modify the registry on a SharePoint system
rule.description:
Do not modify the registry on a SharePoint system. If this is necessary ensure that no SharePoint keys are modified and that changes are deleted during deinstallation of your code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not modify Farm settings via code
rule.description:
Do not change properties of the SPFarm object and do not call methods that modify the SPFarm configuration. Such changes should be done only by the farm administrator or should be part of a deployment script e.g. with PowerShell.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not activate Farm features via code
rule.description:
Do not activate or deactivate features with Farm scope. This operation should only be done by the farm administrator or should be part of a deployment script e.g. with PowerShell.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not modify WebApplication settings via code
rule.description:
Do not change properties of the SPWebApplication object and do not call methods that modify the SPWebApplication configuration. Such changes should be done only by the farm administrator or should be part of a deployment script e.g. with PowerShell.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not activate WebApp features via code
rule.description:
Do not activate or deactivate features with WebApplication scope. This operation should only be done by the farm administrator or should be part of a deployment script e.g. with PowerShell.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define AssemblyFileVersion in Assembly
rule.description:
In SharePoint changing the AssemblyVersion very frequently can lead to problems, because the full name of the assembly could be used in features or webparts. However, to identify the version of the assembly the attribute 'AssemblyFileVersion' should be used (used with same major version but incremented minor version, build etc.)

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not store Urls hardcoded in Assembly
rule.description:
Remove hard coded Urls from the code and make them configurable.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not inherit WebParts from Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPart
rule.description:
WebParts should be inherited from the ASP.NET Webpart (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart). Do not inherit from the SharePoint WebPart.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Instantiate a new SPSite inside RunWithElevatedPrivileges
rule.description:
An SPSite object created outside the delegate can be referenced inside the delegate, however, the methods and property assessors of the object run with the privileges of the user context in which the objects were created, not with the elevated privileges.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPList.Items.Add
rule.description:
Do not call SPList.Items.Add. Use SPList.AddItem instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPList.Items
rule.description:
Do not call SPList.Items. Use SPList.GetItems(SPQuery query) instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPList.Items.GetItemById()
rule.description:
Do not call SPList.Items.GetItemById(). Use SPList.GetItemById instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPList.Items[]
rule.description:
Do not call SPList.Items[int] or SPList.Items[Guid]. Use SPList.GetItemByUniqueId(Guid) or SPList.GetItemById(int) instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPList.Items.Count
rule.description:
Do not call SPList.Items.Count. Use SPList.ItemCount instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPListItemVersion.Delete to delete multiple versions
rule.description:
When you delete multiple versions of a list item, use the DeleteByID() method; do not use the Delete() method. You will experience performance problems if you delete each SPListItemVersion object from an SPListItemVersionCollection object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPFileVersion.Delete to delete multiple versions
rule.description:
When you delete multiple versions of a file, use the DeleteByID() method; do not use the Delete() method. You will experience performance problems if you delete each SPFileVersion object from an SPFileVersionVersionCollection object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not enable ObjectTracking in Linq.DataContext
rule.description:
If your code only queries lists, rather than adding, deleting, or editing list items, then you can turn off object change tracking. Doing so will improve performance. Set the ObjectTrackingEnabled property to false.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not access SPListCollection by indexer multiple times
rule.description:
Do not access SPListCollection by indexer multiple times. Instantiates the list object only once and assigns it to a variable in order to set properties and call methods.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPFolder.Files.Count
rule.description:
Do not call SPFolder.Files.Count. Use SPFolder.ItemCount instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use SPBuiltInContentTypeId to reference builtin ContentType
rule.description:
Use SPBuiltInContentTypeId to reference builtin ContentType.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use SPBuiltInFieldId to reference builtin Field
rule.description:
Use SPBuiltInFieldId to reference builtin Field.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define RowLimit for SPQuery
rule.description:
Define RowLimit for SPQuery to limit the number of items returned in the query.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid using AppSettings to store configuration values
rule.description:
Avoid storing or reading configuration values in web.config via AppSettings.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Apply lock when caching SharePoint objects
rule.description:
Some SharePoint objects are not thread safe and caching can cause applications to fail and cause unexpected or unrelated user errors. To avoid this ensure locking of cached objects.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPItemEventProperties.OpenWeb()
rule.description:
Do not call SPItemEventProperties.OpenWeb(). Use the newly introduced SPItemEventProperties.Web property instead for better performance and to avoid the need to call Dispose().

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not request SPField from SPFieldCollection by index. Use SPFieldCollection.GetField() instead.
rule.description:
Calling SPFieldCollection[] to retrieve a SPField in a web could fail if not the display name is used as argument. Better use SPWeb.Fields.GetField() which returns the field with the specified internal, display, or static name.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call SPWeb.GetListFromUrl. Use SPWeb.GetListFromWebPartPageUrl instead.
rule.description:
SPWeb.GetListFromUrl gets the list that is associated with the first Web Part on the specified Web Parts page. Beginning in Windows SharePoint Services 3.0, use the GetListFromWebPartPageUrl method instead of this method.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call PublishingWeb.GetPublishingPages()
rule.description:
Do not call PublishingWeb.GetPublishingPages(). Use PublishingWeb.GetPublishingPages(SPQuery query) or PublishingWeb.GetPublishingPages(uint rowLimit) instead to improve performance and limit the number of returned pages. Note: PublishingWeb.GetPublishingPages() does not return pages inside subfolders. Use then PublishingWeb.GetPublishingPages(SPQuery query) instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Assign RowLimit for SPQuery in limited range
rule.description:
Assign RowLimit for SPQuery within the limited range (default 1 to 2000).

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use SPMonitoredScope with Developer Dashboard, on all custom code
rule.description:
When enabling developer dashboard feature in SharePoint 2010, in order to get all of the custom code included in the developer dashboard output, wrap it in a monitored scope.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Timer jobs instances should be created in a Feature Activated
rule.description:
When creating a new Timer Job instance, ensure that it is created in the FeatureActivated method of a Feature Receiver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use SPMonitoredScope with Developer Dashboard, on all custom code
rule.description:
When enabling developer dashboard feature in SharePoint 2010, in order to get all of the custom code included in the developer dashboard output, wrap it in a monitored scope.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not activate or deactivate Features via API
rule.description:
Do not activate or deactivate Features in code via API. Consider using PowerShell or Feature Stapling.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider using SPContentTypeCollection.BestMatch(SPContentTypeId) to retrieve a Content Type
rule.description:
Use SPContentTypeCollection.BestMatch(string) to retrieve a Content Type from a SPContentTypeCollection.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not instantiate SPList in Receiver
rule.description:
Do not instantiate an SPList object within an event receiver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not instantiate SPListItem in Receiver
rule.description:
Do not instantiate an SPListItem object within an event receiver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not instantiate SPSite in Receiver
rule.description:
Do not instantiate an SPSite object within an event receiver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not instantiate SPWeb in Receiver
rule.description:
Do not instantiate an SPWeb object within an event receiver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy Assembly which must run in full trust to GAC
rule.description:
The Assembly must be deployed to global assembly cache because it contains code which must be run in full trust or must be avaible to other components or services.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid deployment of Assembly to GAC if it is not necessary
rule.description:
Assemblies should only be deployed to global assembly cache (GAC) if they contain e.g. feature receivers, event receivers, timer jobs or workflows. Consider the deployment to WebApplication.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy assembly with DEBUG mode
rule.description:
Assembly should be build with RELEASE mode. Main reason is to prevent running code which is defined within #DEBUG preprocessor directive and which typically should not run in productive environments.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy SharePoint assemblies
rule.description:
In some case Visual Studio or WSPBuilder include SharePoint assemblies into the package (e.g. Microsoft.Search.dll). This is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy assembly multiple times
rule.description:
In some case the same assembly is included in several WSP packages of the same solution. This can occur if Visual Studio or WSPBuilder includes the files automatically into the WSP package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy empty Assemblies
rule.description:
Assemblies without custom classes should not be deployed to SharePoint. This helps to reduce unneeded IISResets during deployment.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy SPWebConfigModifications via features
rule.description:
Deployment of SPWebConfigModifications with a feature receiver should be avoided. The activation of this feature will start a timer job and will initiate the restart of services which may lead to problems during a deployment. Consider deploying of SPWebConfigModifications via PowerShell script or supplemental config file.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to only deploy Farm Scoped Timer Jobs when required
rule.description:
A Farm Scoped Timer Job can signify a risk to the farm. If it becomes unstable or slow it will affect the entire farm and can potentially bring the Farm down.The upgrade process of Farm Scoped Timer Jobs is also a concern, the process is complicated and can easily go wrong.A final note, most Farm Scoped Timer Jobs cannot be migrated to the CAM model without re-architecting the solution considerably.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not create managed paths in code
rule.description:
The assembly should not create managed paths in a web application.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement IHttpHandler
rule.description:
The assembly should not implement the interface IHttpHandler.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement IHttpModule
rule.description:
The assembly should not implement the interface IHttpModule.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement SPJobDefinition (TimerJob)
rule.description:
The assembly should not implement the interface SPJobDefinition in gold environments.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement FeatureReceiver
rule.description:
The assembly should not types inherited from 'Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFeatureReceiver'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement SPWebConfigModifications
rule.description:
The assembly should not implement SPWebConfigModifications.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement Pluggable Autentication Provider
rule.description:
The assembly should not implement Pluggable Autentication Provider.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement Pluggable SSO Provider
rule.description:
The assembly should not implement Pluggable SSO Provider.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add attribute 'AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers'
rule.description:
Code in the sandboxed worker process can call only assemblies that have the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallersAttribute.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reference unavailable NET 3.5 assemblies
rule.description:
Code in the sandbox runs as a partially trusted caller. This means that such code can access only those .NET Framework 3.5 assemblies that have the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallersAttribute attribute.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use unallowed SharePoint classes
rule.description:
Only a subset of the APIs in Microsoft.SharePoint.dll are available in sandboxed solutions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not inherit WebParts from SharePoint WebPart
rule.description:
Sandboxed solutions can include only Web Parts derived from the ASP.NET class.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reference assemblies without AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers attribute
rule.description:
Code in the sandboxed worker process can call only assemblies that have the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallersAttribute. This means that most custom assemblies that you deploy in sandboxed solutions must have this attribute.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not create static fields and properties
rule.description:
Avoid creating static fields and properties in your sandboxed code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Create SPSite with correct parameters
rule.description:
A new SPSite can only be instantiated in sandboxed solutions if calling code conforms to certain restrictions on the parameters that are passed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not set Read-Only Properties
rule.description:
Some properties of SharePoint objects are read/write in farm solutions, but are read-only in sandboxed solutions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Assembly to GAC
rule.description:
Assemblies cannot be deployed to GAC in Sandboxed Solutions

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose created SPSite objects
rule.description:
When you create a SPSite object with a new operator, the creating application must dispose of it.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPWeb objects created with SPSite.OpenWeb
rule.description:
The OpenWeb method create an SPWeb object and return it to the caller. This new object is not stored in the SPSite object and is not disposed of anywhere in the SPSite class. For this reason, you should dispose of any object created via these methods.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPSite objects created with SPSite.SelfServiceCreateSite
rule.description:
The SelfServiceCreateSite method (all signatures) create an SPWeb object and return it to the caller. This new object is not stored in the SPSite object and is not disposed of anywhere in the SPSite class. For this reason, you should dispose of any object created via these methods.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPWeb created by SPLimitedWebPartManager
rule.description:
The SPLimitedWebPartManager class contains a reference to an internal SPWeb object that must be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPSite created by SPSiteCollection.Add
rule.description:
The SPSiteCollection.Add method creates and returns a new SPSite object. You should dispose of any SPSite object returned from the SPSiteCollection.Add method.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPSite created by SPSiteCollection[] index operator
rule.description:
The SPSiteCollection [] index operator returns a new SPSite object for each access. An SPSite instance is created even if that object was already accessed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPWeb created by SPWebCollection.Add
rule.description:
The SPSite.AllWebs.Add method and SPWebCollection.Add method creates and returns an SPWeb object. You should dispose of any SPWeb object returned.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPWeb created by SPWebCollection[] index operator
rule.description:
The SPSite.AllWebs[] and SPWebCollection[] index operator returns a new SPWeb instance each time it is accessed. An object is created during the indexing operation even if that object was already accessed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPListEventProperties.Web
rule.description:
The SPWeb object in SPListEventProperties (e.g. used in a SPListEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPWebEventProperties.Web
rule.description:
The SPWeb object in SPWebEventProperties (e.g. used in a SPWebEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.Web
rule.description:
The SPWeb object in SPItemEventProperties (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web
rule.description:
The object in SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.Web.Site
rule.description:
The object in SPItemEventProperties.Web.Site (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web.Site
rule.description:
The object in SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web.Site (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPFeatureReceiverProperties.Feature.Parent
rule.description:
The object in SPFeatureReceiverProperties.Feature.Parent (e.g. used in a SPFeatureReceiver) should not be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPSite.RootWeb
rule.description:
An earlier version of the documentation indicated that the calling application should dispose of the SPSite.RootWeb property just before disposing of the SPSite object that is using it. This is no longer the official guidance. The dispose cleanup is handled automatically by the SharePoint framework.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPWeb.ParentWeb
rule.description:
An earlier version of the documentation recommended that the calling application should dispose of the SPWeb.ParentWeb. This is no longer the official guidance. The dispose cleanup is handled automatically by the SharePoint framework.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPList.ParentWeb
rule.description:
An earlier version of the documentation recommended that the calling application should dispose of the SPWeb.ParentWeb. This is no longer the official guidance. The dispose cleanup is handled automatically by the SharePoint framework.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPSite returned by SPControl.GetContextSite
rule.description:
If SPSite is obtained from the SharePoint context objects (GetContextSite method), the calling application should not call the Dispose method on the object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPWeb returned by SPControl.GetContextWeb
rule.description:
If SPWeb is obtained from the SharePoint context objects (GetContextWeb method), the calling application should not call the Dispose method on the object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPSite returned by SPContext.Current.Site
rule.description:
SPContext objects are managed by the SharePoint framework and should not be explicitly disposed in your code. This is true also for the SPSite objects returned by SPContext.Site and SPContext.Current.Site

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not dispose SPWeb returned by SPContext.Current.Web
rule.description:
SPContext objects are managed by the SharePoint framework and should not be explicitly disposed in your code. This is true also for the SPWeb objects returned by SPContext.Web and SPContext.Current.Web

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Close PublishingWeb created by PublishingWeb.GetPublishingWebs[] index operator
rule.description:
The GetPublishingWebs method of the PublishingWeb class returns a PublishingWebCollection object. You must call the Close method on each enumerated innerPubWeb object. When you are calling only the GetPublishingWeb method, you are not required to call Close.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Close PublishingWeb created by PublishingWeb.GetVariation
rule.description:
The Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.PublishingWeb.GetVariation method returns a PublishingWeb object that must be closed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Close PublishingWeb created by PublishingWebCollection.Add
rule.description:
PublishingWebCollection.Add() method requires you to call Close on the returned PublishingWeb object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Dispose SPSite created with UserProfiles.PersonalSite
rule.description:
The Microsoft.Office.Server.UserProfiles.PersonalSite returns an SPSite object that must be disposed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call deprecated methods or properties
rule.description:
Assembly should not call deprecated methods or properties.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement deprecated interfaces
rule.description:
Assembly should not implement deprecated interfaces.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not inherit from deprecated type
rule.description:
Assembly should not inherit from deprecated type.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reference deprecated types
rule.description:
Assembly should not reference deprecated types.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call deprecated methods or properties
rule.description:
Assembly should not call deprecated methods or properties.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement deprecated interfaces
rule.description:
Assembly should not implement deprecated interfaces.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not inherit from deprecated type
rule.description:
Assembly should not inherit from deprecated type.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reference deprecated types
rule.description:
Assembly should not reference deprecated types.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not call CustomizeCss and RevertCss from Microsoft.SharePoint.SoapServer.Webs
rule.description:
Do not call CustomizeCss and RevertCss from namespace Microsoft.SharePoint.SoapServer.Webs. The  methods are included in SharePoint 2013, but will be removed from the next major release of SharePoint.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Build assembly for .NET Framework 4.5
rule.description:
The Assembly should be build for target Framework version 4.5.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive in strings within code
rule.description:
References in strings in the code to hive folder '/_controltemplates', '/_layouts' and '/_layouts/images/' must be changed accordingly to point to the 15 hive (e.g. by changing to '/_controltemplates/15/').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid use of SPMonitoredScope in Render and OnInit methods
rule.description:
To get all of the customcode included in the developer dashboard output, wrap it in a monitored scope, but avoid it using in OnInit and Render event handlers.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid Verbose Logging/Tracing in production code
rule.description:
Verbose logging, or tracing information, can lead to huge log files which affect the performance.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not retrieve SPListItemCollection inside loop
rule.description:
Do not retrieve SPListItemCollection inside loop. Iterating through items of Sharepoint List, in every loop, if we request a new SPListItemCollection object when accessing the Items property. The Items property is not cached and therefore always requests all items from the database over and over again.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Verify the CheckOutType before checking out an item
rule.description:
When you check out an item in SharePoint, make sure that it is not already checked out.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: You must call Update() to persist any changes to the Web object.
rule.description:
When modifying the Web object you need to call Web.Update() in order to persist the changes to the object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: You must call List.Update() to persist any changes to the List object.
rule.description:
When modifying the List object you need to call List.Update() in order to persist the changes to the object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: You must call both Field.Update() to save any changes to the Field object.
rule.description:
When modifying a Field object you need to call Field.Update() in order to persist the changes to the object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: You must call Update() to persist any changes to the ListItem object.
rule.description:
When modifying the ListItem object you need to call ListItem.Update() in order to persist the changes to the object.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Verify that the File is checked out before checking it in.
rule.description:
When you check in an item in SharePoint, consider verifying that it is checked out using CheckOutType first.

See SPCAF documentation
